title.rendered: GREAT Scholarship by University of Derby 2025 [Funding Rs.10 L]: Apply by May 31

content.rendered:
Applications are invited for the University of Derby GREAT Scholarships 2025. Apply before the deadline of 31st May 2025 to secure your admission.

About the University of Derby

Located in the heart of England, the University of Derby offers applied learning, with a key focus on employability and practical skills. Derby has received the prestigious Gold rating from the Teaching Excellence Framework (TEF), and is Top 20 in the UK for teaching quality (The Times and Sunday Times Good University Guide 2024). As many of their expert academics are still in practice in their field or are undertaking life-changing research, students can benefit from teaching underpinned by research and industry connections.

Essential Information

  • In partnership with the British Council and the GREAT Britain Campaign, the University of Derby is offering scholarships to students in India applying for postgraduate courses.   
  • The GREAT Scholarships 2025-26 programme supports postgraduate students to access world-class UK higher education opportunities.
  • The scholarship programme offers financial support of £10,000 to eligible students in India pursuing one year postgraduate study at the University of Derby in programmes related to Science and Technology, in the following subjects: 
    • Big Data Analytics MSc
    • Cyber Security MSc
    • Information Technology MSc

Eligibility

  • Be a citizen of India
  • Have an undergraduate degree that will enable you to gain entry onto a postgraduate programme at a UK university
  • Motivated and academically able to follow and benefit from a UK postgraduate taught course
  • Active in the field with work experience or with a proven interest in the proposed subject area
  • Meet the English language requirement of the University of Derby
  • Willing to embody the University of Derby experience, by attending lectures and tutorials and engaging with extra-curricular activities, and act as an ambassador for University of Derby, by promoting the value of studying at a UK HEI
  • Willing to establish an engagement with the UK as a scholar, through personal and academic fulfilment
  • Represent the high standards of the GREAT brand by becoming an advocate for scholarships
  • be willing to attend events or participate in other activities organised by Study UK and the British Council for all UK-based GREAT scholars, including social media activities to discuss experiences and capture perceptions of studying in the UK

On return:

  • Willing to demonstrate future contribution to capacity-building and socio-economic advancement through the benefits achieved after graduating from UK higher education
  • Willing to maintain contact with the British Council and act as an ambassador for the GREAT Scholarships, by sharing experiences of studying in the UK with future GREAT scholars
  • As an alumnus of the GREAT Scholarships, willing occasionally to speak to potential candidates about his or her own experience of studying in the UK

Deadline

Deadline: 31 May 2025, Midnight (BST)

How to apply?

  • Applications for the British Council GREAT scholarship should be made after you have received an offer, using the form below. As part of your application you will need to include an essay of no more than 500 words about a topic you have studied previously and why you found it interesting. This topic should be related to or have inspired you to apply for your chosen degree programme. This essay will be part of the shortlisting criteria, alongside previous academic achievement, and the potential you show. 
    • Shortlisted applicants may be asked to attend a video interview with the selection committee 
    • The deadline for applications for this scholarship is 23 April 2025 
    • Successful awardees of the GREAT Scholarship will be notified of the outcome after 31 May 2025
    • If you are awarded a GREAT scholarship, you are not eligible to receive any other scholarships or discounts from the University of Derby 
    • Please note that applicants should be passport holders of India.
